content: Rate our marriage 1-10. I'll go first: 11.
You're my favorite wife. Don't tell the others.
Quick poll: Am I the best husband ever? (Only correct answers please)
I call big spoon tonight. No arguments.
Just did something dumb. Preemptive sorry.
You're stuck with me. Terms and conditions applied at wedding.
Still married? Nice. Let's keep this going.
I made coffee. Expecting husband of the year nomination.
Thinking about our first date. We've aged well. Mostly you.
You + me + takeout + couch = perfect night.
I fold one basket of laundry and suddenly I'm marriage material.
If we were on a reality show, we'd be the couple everyone roots for.
I'm approximately 78% sure you like me. Maybe 79%.
Marriage is just choosing who to annoy forever. Glad it's you.
I put the toilet seat down. You're welcome.
Remember when you said yes? No take-backs.
Rock paper scissors for who picks dinner?
You're cute when you're pretending not to be mad at me.
We should get matching tattoos. Or matching snacks. Snacks.
I'd wife you again. Just saying.
Relationship status: Still finding you adorable.
Our vibe: Netflix, snacks, and ignoring responsibilities together.
You're the Jim to my Pam. Or the Pam to my Jim. Whatever.
I love you more than you love your phone. That's saying something.
Let's be irresponsible and order dessert for dinner.
Pros of being married to me: I'm hilarious. Cons: None. Obviously.
We should go on a date. Maybe even talk to each other.
I made a pros and cons list. You're all pros. Except you steal covers.
Couple goals: Us. Specifically.
If you need me, I'll be wherever you are. Because I'm clingy.
Our love language: Making fun of each other.
Today's mood: Wanting to hang out with you. Also every day's mood.
I'd let you pick the movie. That's love.
If marriage was a sport, we'd be championship level.
You're the only person I'd share my food with. Sometimes.
Let's be that old couple who still holds hands. Deal?
You're my person. Like, legally. Signed documents and everything.
I'd pick you first in any draft. Marriage draft. It's a thing.
We're basically a romcom but with more laundry.
Thanks for accepting my terms and conditions at the altar.
Want to make out later? After the kids are asleep. In like 4 hours. Plan ahead.
I'd take a bullet for you. Or make you dinner. Same energy.
You're my emergency contact. Legally and emotionally.
Sometimes I forget we're married. Then I remember. And I'm happy.
Just stared at our wedding photo. We looked so young and dumb. Cute though.
Team us forever. Unless you eat my leftovers.
I promise to always pretend to listen. Marriage stuff.
Let's never grow up. But also, let's nap. Adult naps.
Marriage is wild. Glad I'm doing it with you.
You're my ride or die. Mostly ride. To the grocery store.
